div.l: And payed for þe souꝑper eủery del
Of aleȳn ⁊and of Iohn þᵗat bete hȳm wel
Hese wyf is swyuyd ⁊and hese doughtyr als
Lo swich It is a meller͗emellemeller͗e to bēn fals
And þ̉erfore this ꝓproủerbe is seyd ful soth
Hȳm thar not wene wel þᵗat euele doth
A gylour schalschaschal hym self begylede be
And god þᵗat settyth hye īn īn mageste
Save alle þese cūmpanyis grate ⁊and smale
Thus haue I quit þe mellere in mȳn tale
THe cook of lundene whil þe reue spak
For ioye hȳm thouȝte he clawede hȳm on þᵉ bak
Ha ha ha for c̉ristys passyoıı̄un
This mallere hadde a scharp cōnclusyoıı̄un
Vp on his argumēnt of herbergage
Wel seyde salamon / on his langage
Ne brȳnge not eủery with in to þȳn hous
For herberwȳnge be nyȝte is ꝑperlyous
Wel auȝte a mān avysede for to be
Whōm þᵗat he brouȝte in to hese p̉riuyte
I preye to god so ȝeue me sorwe ⁊and care
Syn eủere I highte hoge of ware
Herde I euere a mellere betere I set a werke
He hadde a Iape of maleys in þe derke
But god for bede þᵗat we stēntȳn here
And þ̉erfore ȝif ȝe wouche saf to here
A tale of me þᵗat am a pore man
I wele ȝow telle as wel as eủere I can
A lytyl Iape what fel in oure cete
Oure ost answerde ⁊and seyde I graıı̄unte it þe
Now telle on roger ⁊and loke þᵗat it be good
For manye a paste hast þᵘou letȳn blod
And manye a rakke of doủere hast þᵘou sold
